[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Media Library Management System (MLMS) defines requirements for handling CD lending, reservations, and event participation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: MLMS supports CD borrowing, reservations, event scheduling, and inventory tracking.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: MLMS integrates with library databases, membership records, and payment processing systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: MLMS provides an interface for members to borrow CDs, reserve items, and register for events.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: MLMS supports barcode scanners and self-checkout kiosks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: MLMS uses PostgreSQL, MongoDB, REST APIs, and OAuth 2.0 for secure authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: MLMS secures transactions via TLS encryption and role-based access control.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: MLMS optimizes data storage for CD inventory and event scheduling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: MLMS manages CD loans, reservations, event participation, and availability notifications.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: MLMS is configurable for different library branches and policies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: MLMS connects with digital catalog services and external event management platforms.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: MLMS handles CD lending, reservations, and event scheduling.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for library members, staff, and administrators managing media loans and events.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: Reservations are limited to one CD per member at a time.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: MLMS relies on accurate membership records and real-time inventory updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Reservation: Request to borrow an available CD.
Event: Scheduled library activity with registration.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall manage CD loans and reservations (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall track event registrations and participant records (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall integrate with external payment services for event registration fees.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow members to borrow and return CDs within a predefined lending period (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall enable CD reservations and notify members upon availability (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow staff to create events with participant limits and members to register if space permits (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an interface for members to borrow CDs, reserve media, and register for events.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process CD transactions within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store CD inventory, lending records, and reservations.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall store event schedules and participant details.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall enforce unique identifiers for members, CDs, and events.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with library lending policies and digital media licensing regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain logs of borrowing transactions, event registrations, and compliance audits.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests CD loans, reservations, event scheduling, and compliance tracking.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and compliance policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Library lending policies, event participation guidelines, and digital media regulations.
